com.software.reuze

Class gb_Vector3

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.gb_Vector3
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    gb_Vector3Id

    public class gb_Vector3
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Encapsulates a 3D vector. Allows chaining operations by returning a reference to it self in all modification methods.
    Author:
    badlogicgames@gmail.com
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • prj

        public gb_Vector3 prj(m_Matrix4 matrix)
        Multiplies this vector by the given matrix dividing by w. This is mostly used to project/unproject vectors via a perspective projection matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix.
        Returns:
        This vector for chaining

        public gb_Vector3 lerp(gb_Vector3 target,
              float alpha)
        Linearly interpolates between this vector and the target vector by alpha which is in the range [0,1]. The result is stored in this vector.
        Parameters:
        target - The target vector
        alpha - The interpolation coefficient
        Returns:
        This vector for chaining.

        Returns:
        the vec3 d

      • signum

        public gb_Vector3 signum()
        Replaces all vector components with the signum of their original values. In other words if a components value was negative its new value will be -1, if zero => 0, if positive => +1
        Returns:
        itself

      • getClosestAxis

        public final gb_Vector3 getClosestAxis()
        Identifies the closest cartesian axis to this vector. If at least two vector components are equal, no unique decision can be made and the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Vector3 or null

      • fromXYTheta

        public static final gb_Vector3 fromXYTheta(float theta)
        Creates a new vector from the given angle in the XY plane. The Z component of the vector will be zero. The resulting vector for theta=0 is equal to the positive X axis.
        Parameters:
        theta - the theta
        Returns:
        new vector in the XY plane

      • fromXZTheta

        public static final gb_Vector3 fromXZTheta(float theta)
        Creates a new vector from the given angle in the XZ plane. The Y component of the vector will be zero. The resulting vector for theta=0 is equal to the positive X axis.
        Parameters:
        theta - the theta
        Returns:
        new vector in the XZ plane

      • fromYZTheta

        public static final gb_Vector3 fromYZTheta(float theta)
        Creates a new vector from the given angle in the YZ plane. The X component of the vector will be zero. The resulting vector for theta=0 is equal to the positive Y axis.
        Parameters:
        theta - the theta
        Returns:
        new vector in the YZ plane

      • computeAveragePoint

        public static gb_Vector3 computeAveragePoint(Iterable<? extends gb_Vector3> points)
        Returns the arithmetic mean of the x, y, z, and w coordinates of the specified points Iterable. This returns null if the Iterable contains no points, or if all of the points are null.
        Parameters:
        points - the Iterable of points which define the returned arithmetic mean.
        Returns:
        the arithmetic mean point of the specified points Iterable, or null if the Iterable is empty or contains only null points.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Iterable is null.

      • clamp

         float floor,
         float ceiling)
